author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Alberta’s County of Northern Lights is located along the Peace River about halfway between Edmonton and the Northwest Territories and has long been favoured by nuclear energy companies for one primary reason: it has ample access to frigid river water for cooling nuclear reactors.  Fifty-seven percent of voters expressed opposition in a non-binding Oct. 20 […]
title: Northern Alberta County Split Over Nuclear Power Plant Proposal

author: Chandra Philip
description: A Calgary pastor says he is facing more jail time over his refusal to write an apology letter to a local librarian that he confronted about three years ago during a protest against drag queen story time for children. The pastor, Derek Reimer, was previously arrested and charged for protesting library drag queen story times […]
title: Calgary Pastor Says He Faces More Jail Time After Refusing to Write Apology Letter Over Drag Story Time Protest

author: Chandra Philip
description: A team of genealogy researchers in Calgary is striving to solve the mystery of a box brimming with seemingly random historical items that was left at a local thrift store. Included in the items received by the WorldServe Thrift Store in May was a photograph of a telegraphers union members conference from the early 1900s, […]
title: Calgary Genealogists Working to Unravel Mystery of Thrift Store Box of Historical Memorabilia

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Canada’s cyber defence agency has said hackers are increasingly targeting Canada’s water systems, and that hackers backed by foreign states have gained access to these systems and could launch attacks “in times of crisis or conflict between states.” “We assess that state-sponsored cyber threat actors have almost certainly developed pre-positioned access to Canadian water systems,” […]
title: State-Backed Hackers Gained ‘Pre-positioned Access’ to Canadian Water Systems: Cyber Defence Agency

author: Noé Chartier
description: Canadian citizens travelling to the United Kingdom will soon need to obtain a travel authorization from the British government before boarding a flight. The British Home Office announced this week that visitors from 85 countries who can travel  to the United Kingdom without a visa will be required to obtain an Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) […]
title: Canadians Travelling to UK Will Need Electronic Pre-Authorization Starting in February 2026

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand told a parliamentary committee this week the foreign agent registry is expected to be operational by year’s end, as a Tory MP cautioned that Canada will risk being viewed as a “playground for foreign interference” if delays continue. Anand told the Foreign Affairs and International Development committee that Public Safety […]
title: MPs Push Minister Anand for Foreign Agent Registry Timeline, Say Interference a Major Concern

author: Glenn Blackett
description: Commentary Alberta Premier Danielle Smith has introduced a bill to protect lawyers, doctors, and other professionals from censorship by their regulators. Bill 13 is being called “Peterson Law” after psychologist Jordan Peterson, prosecuted by his regulator for speaking his mind, as Smith says, “on his own time.” Great news, at least until you read the […]
title: Alberta’s Proposed ‘Peterson Law’ Doesn’t Go Far Enough

author: Chandra Philip
description: Vancouver police have confiscated several firearms and various other weapons, including a grenade launcher and bull whips, during a recent raid at a rooming house in the city’s Downtown Eastside. The rooming house was believed to be fuelling “a supply line of contraband throughout the neighbourhood,” the Vancouver Police Department said in a Nov. 27 […]
title: Vancouver Police Seize Grenade Launcher, Drugs in Downtown Eastside Rooming House

author: Bill Pan
description: The US authority warned of a potential hazard in Venezuelan airspace due to a ‘worsening security situation and heightened military activity.’
title: Venezuela Bans Six International Airlines That Observed US Airspace Warning

author: The Canadian Press
description: Analysts at CIBC Capital Markets say they don’t expect the private sector to take the lead on a new West Coast oilsands pipeline so long as the British Columbia government and First Nations are opposed. “The requirement to consult with B.C. and indigenous groups is necessary and logical,” they wrote in a report Friday, a […]
title: CIBC Analysts Cast Doubt on Private Sector Taking on New BC Pipeline Any Time Soon

author: The Canadian Press
description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand says budget cuts at Global Affairs Canada won’t affect the ability of Canadians in trouble abroad to get help from embassies. Department officials say the cuts will involve moving some consular services to an online portal. The recent federal budget includes a $561 million cut to the department’s budget next […]
title: Anand Says Global Affairs Cuts Won’t Harm Consular Access

author: Jarvis Lim
description: While Xi touted a stable relationship with Washington, Beijing’s actions suggest otherwise.
title: China’s Military Expansion, Support for Russia Entrench Structural Conflict With US: Analysts

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Andriy Yermak, a close friend of the president's for years who was leading Kyiv's negotiations with Russia, had his home searched by anti-corruption officers.
title: Zelenskyy’s Right-Hand Man Quits as Ukraine’s Corruption Scandal Escalates

author: Michael Zwaagstra
description: Commentary If there’s one thing that most parents and teachers agree about, it’s that split classes, where students from two or more grades are combined in one class, are a bad idea. It’s not hard to see why parents dislike split classes. It strains credulity to think that children will get the same individualized attention […]
title: Michael Zwaagstra: How Education Bureaucracy Is Forcing Split Classes in Ontario

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Sexual extortion of children for profit is on the rise, Canada’s financial intelligence agency says, and a large portion of such activities are tied to organized crime. This form of online coercion consists of threats to share sexual images or videos of a victim unless they provide the offenders with money or additional pictures, the […]
title: Incidents of Sexual Extortion for Money Targeting Youth Escalating: Financial Intelligence Agency

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Canada’s gross domestic product (GDP) grew by 2.6 percent on an annualized basis in the third quarter of 2025 due to a decline in imports and a rise in exports, after falling by 1.8 percent in the second quarter. The growth in GDP during the third quarter far surpassed Statistic Canada’s projection of 0.4 percent […]
title: Canada’s GDP Grew by 2.6 Percent in Third Quarter of 2025: StatCan

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Politicians from several parties have reacted to former Environment Minister Steven Guilbeault’s resignation from cabinet over Prime Minister Mark Carney’s deal with Alberta to advance a pipeline and modify several Trudeau-era environmental policies. On Nov. 27, hours after Carney and Alberta Premier Danielle Smith signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to pave the way for […]
title: Politicians React to Former Environment Minister Guilbeault’s Resignation

author: Guy Birchall
description: Friedrich Merz has been vocal in his support of the idea of using Moscow's assets immobilized within the EU to fund Ukraine's war effort and reconstruction.
title: Need to Use Frozen Russian Assests ‘Increasingly Urgent’: German Chancellor

author: Catherine Yang
description: A Japanese official said an attack on Taiwan would be 'survival threatening.' China responded angrily, even banning Japan's seafood. The U.S. sided with Japan.
title: Here’s How the CCP-Japan Feud Escalated

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A recall has been issued for Celebration Herbals Senna Leaf herbal tea across multiple provinces due to potential salmonella contamination. The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) issued an alert on Nov. 26 after a recall was triggered by the company. The product was distributed in British Columbia, Ontario, and New Brunswick, and was also sold […]
title: Herbal Tea Recalled Due to Salmonella Contamination Concerns

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal government has launched a public registry to keep Canadians in the loop on its growing use of artificial intelligence. The registry lists more than 400 areas where AI is currently being explored, developed, implemented or deployed within the government, including early research projects and tools for operations and service delivery. A Treasury Board […]
title: Ottawa Launches Public Registry Listing More Than 400 Federal AI Projects

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Commercial carriers in Alberta will now be required to provide driver experience records for Class 1 truck drivers, as part of provincial measures to ensure future employers and insurers have the information needed to assess a driver before they get behind the wheel. The province made the announcement on Nov. 26, describing it as one […]
title: Alberta to Implement Stricter Measures to Address ‘Bad Truck Drivers’

author: The Canadian Press
description: Pipeline operator Trans Mountain Corp. says it earned a profit in its latest quarter compared with a loss a year ago as its utilization rate and revenue rose compared with last year. The Crown-owned pipeline company says it earned $127 million for the quarter ended Sept. 30 compared with a loss of $68 million a […]
title: Trans Mountain Reports $127M Q3 Profit as Revenue and Utilization Rise

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The majority of Canadians and British Columbians would support a new oil pipeline from Alberta to the B.C. coast, a new poll suggests. In the Angus Reid poll released Nov. 27, 60 percent of Canadians nationwide said they would support a pipeline from Alberta to B.C. Of the B.C. residents surveyed, 53 percent said they […]
title: 53 Percent of British Columbians Support a New Pipeline From Alberta: Poll

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The European Council has signed off on plans to eliminate industrial tariffs and extend duty-free access for American agricultural goods.
title: EU Backs Deep Tariff Cuts for American Goods

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Three Calgary police officers are facing charges in connection with two separate but linked investigations into sexual misconduct. An investigation was initiated in January 2025 after allegations surfaced that an officer who met women while on duty had engaged in, or attempted to engage in, sexual contact with them both during and outside of work […]
title: 3 Calgary Police Officers Charged Following Sexual Misconduct Investigations

author: The Canadian Press
description: Federal Energy and Natural Resources Minister Tim Hodgson says it’s “premature” for anyone to draw conclusions regarding the potential removal, or adjustment, of the West Coast tanker ban, since no pipeline route has been mapped out to bring oil from Alberta to the B.C. coastline. In an interview with The Canadian Press, Hodgson said people […]
title: Hodgson Says It’s ‘Premature’ to Draw Conclusions About BC Tanker Ban Fate

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The spending boost is set to expand the ESA’s Earth-observation, navigation, and resilience programs.
title: Europe Approves Record $25 Billion Budget for Space Agency

author: Gerry Bowler
description: Commentary You never know what peace is until you walk on the shores or in the fields or along the winding red roads of Prince Edward Island in a summer twilight when the dew is falling and the old stars are peeping out and the sea keeps its mighty tryst with the little land it […]
title: The Enormous Contribution of ‘Anne of Green Gables’ Author L.M. Montgomery to Canadian Literary Life

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Brazilian authorities have executed 126 search and seizure warrants across five states, as part of a crackdown on an organized crime network.

description: He was previously removed from United States three times between 2007 and 2023.

description: International leaders sent condolences after at least 128 people died in a fire at Wang Fuk Court in Tai Po.
title: Rescue Operation at Hong Kong Fire Ends as Death Toll Climbs to 128 With Hundreds Missing

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The wild horses of Australia's Kosciuszko National Park will be treated as feral pests after a reform passed parliament with mass support.
title: Thousands of Kosciuszko Brumbies Face Cull After Heritage Protections Removed

description: 43 gang associates have been arrested over an alleged drug-smuggling syndicate operating through Auckland Airport.

description: Senator Fatima Payman pressed the foreign minister on her response to the Trump administration's directive to examine links between mass migration and crime.
title: Wong Defends Multiculturalism, Declines to Condemn Trump Directive on Migrant Crime

author: Reuters
description: BISSAU—Guinea-Bissau’s military installed Major-General Horta Inta-a as transitional president on Thursday, a day after soldiers toppled the civilian leadership in a swift power grab made before the results of a weekend election could be announced. The president who was ousted in the coup, Umaro Sissoco Embalo, arrived in Senegal aboard a special flight following an […]
title: General Sworn In as New Guinea-Bissau Leader, Ousted President Arrives in Senegal

author: Cindy Li
description: Australia keeps its Taiwan position deliberately vague, influenced heavily by its deep economic ties with China.
title: Senior CCP Leader Urges Australia to Respect Beijing’s Taiwan Position

author: The Associated Press
description: LONDON—A rare crystal and diamond Fabergé egg crafted for Russia’s ruling family before it was toppled by revolution is going up for auction, valued at more than 20 million pounds ($26.4 million). Christie’s auction house says the Winter Egg is just one of seven of the opulent ovoids remaining in private hands. It will be […]
title: Crystal Fabergé Egg Crafted for Russian Royalty Expected to Sell for More Than $26 Million

author: Reuters
description: WASHINGTON—Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth visited sailors on the USS Gerald R. Ford aircraft carrier stationed in the Latin American region on Thursday, as President Donald Trump’s administration undertakes a military buildup that has deepened tensions with Venezuela. The Pentagon posted a video showing Hegseth speaking into a public address system, wishing all those aboard […]
title: Hegseth Visits USS Gerald R. Ford Aircraft Carrier in Latin America Region

author: The Associated Press
description: BANGKOK—The death toll from severe flooding in southern Thailand climbed to more than 80 people as floodwaters began to subside Thursday, officials said. About 1 million households and more than 3 million people have been impacted by floods triggered by torrential rains in 12 southern provinces, the Department of Disaster Prevention and Mitigation said Thursday. […]
title: Floodwaters Are Subsiding in Southern Thailand as Deaths Exceed 80

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Australia's Administrative Appeals Tribunal found the eSafety body was using hundreds of informal communications to get content removed to avoid appeals.
title: eSafety Appeals Tribunal Ruling That Limits ‘Informal’ Takedown Alerts on Content

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney and Alberta Premier Danielle Smith signed an agreement on Nov. 27 that paves the way for a new West Coast pipeline if a private proponent comes forward, while also changing key energy policies introduced by the previous Trudeau government. As part of the agreement, Alberta has also made certain commitments to […]
title: 8 Takeaways From Ottawa‑Alberta Pipeline and Energy Deal

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says the new agreement with Ottawa on energy policies marks a shift from a difficult decade of obstacles to resource development and will allow Alberta’s oil and gas sector to grow, contributing to nationwide prosperity. Smith made the comments during an address to industry representatives on Nov. 27, shortly after she […]
title: New Energy Deal With Ottawa a Shift From ‘Dark Times’, Addresses 7 of 9 ‘Bad Laws’, Alberta’s Smith Says

author: Reuters
description: Boeing said on Wednesday it will produce AH-64E Apache attack helicopters for international customers, including 96 for the Polish Armed Forces, under a foreign military sales contract worth nearly $4.7 billion awarded by the U.S. Army. Deliveries are expected to begin in 2028, Boeing said. Poland’s order represents the largest number of Apache aircraft ordered […]
title: Boeing to Build Apache Helicopters for Poland as Part of $4.7 Billion Contract

description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Christmas Tree at Windsor Castle, Thanksgiving Parade, Floods in Malaysia

description: 'I would like to make it clear that there is no such fact,' the Japanese government's top spokesperson said.
title: Japan Denies Trump Asked PM Not to Provoke Beijing

description: The project, expected to generate around 1,000 construction and 500 operational jobs, was given the green light by the state government.
title: BHP Mitsubishi Alliance Abandons Major Queensland Coal Project Over Royalty Dispute

author: Olivia Gomm
description: When Canada does not expel Chinese spies operating within the country, it signals to China and the United States that Canada is “open territory” for Chinese infiltration, says Charles Burton, a China scholar and senior fellow of the Sinopsis think tank. “We’re not expelling people that I believe CSIS knows are espionage agents,” Burton told […]
title: Failing to Expel Chinese Spies Tells China, US That Canada Is ‘Open Territory’ for Chinese Infiltration: Scholar

description: ‘The land is easier, but that's going to start very soon. We’d warn them,’ the president said.

description: The full interview will air on EpochTV at 5 p.m. ET on Nov. 29.
title: Cartels Are Scrambling as Fentanyl Precursor Supply From China Dries Up: FBI Director

author: Chandra Philip
description: A fire at a historic Toronto church that destroyed rare frescoes is now being investigated as a possible arson case, according to police. A four-alarm fire broke out at St. Anne’s Anglican church on June 9, 2024, destroying the building and damaging Group of Seven murals that were inside. The Group of Seven were artists […]
title: Toronto Church Fire That Destroyed Rare Paintings Deemed Possible Arson: Police

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: B.C. Premier David Eby says he is concerned that an Alberta–Ottawa energy agreement including the goal of a pipeline to the B.C. coast could become a “distraction” from other projects in his province. Prime Minister Mark Carney and Alberta Premier Danielle Smith signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) on Nov. 27 committing Ottawa and the […]
title: Premier Eby Concerned That Ottawa-Alberta Deal Will Lessen Focus on Other BC Projects

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The supplier of 'nudifying' apps with more than 100,000 monthly users has backed out after being hit with an enforcement notice.
title: UK ‘Nudify’ App Provider Forced Out of Australia After Child Safety Breach
